cRefPattern.p: This pattern references a specific line.
This pattern references an inscribed surface.
This pattern references a specific artefact, usually a tablet.

div.l: lugal-gu10 {na4}e-le-li im-ma-⸢gub⸣
{d}nin-urta dumu {d}en-lil2-la2-ke4 ⸢nam⸣ am3-ib-tar-re
{na4}e-le-li geštu2 tuku kur dux(LU2) mu2-a-ba ni2-⸢gu10⸣ he2-me-ni-ri
ki-bala ug3 teš2-ba ri-a-ga2 mu-⸢gu10⸣ hu-mu-ni-⸢pa3⸣
silim-ma-zu-ta nam-⸢ba⸣-e-re-be4
gur4-ra-zu tur-e-bi he2-gig
me!-gu10 mar-za si ha-ba-ni-ib2-sa2
{geš}tukul!(TUG2) sag3-ge ur-sag ug5-ga-ga2 šu gal-bi? he2-ni!-du7
x-mah-ga2-a ki-gal ha-ra-an-ri
kalam-e ⸢u6⸣ du10-ge-eš mu-e kur-kur he2-il2-i
ur-sag {na4#}ka-gin6-e ba-gub
nam-kal-ga-⸢bi⸣-⸢še3⸣ ⸢gu3⸣ ba-de2-e
{d}nin-urta dumu {d}en-lil2-la2-ke4 nam am3-ib-tar-re
sul ni2-tuku ⸢geš⸣-nu11 bar-še3 gal2
⸢{na4#}ka⸣-gin6-na ki-bala-ta ⸢gu3⸣ mu-e-re-gal2-la
{na4}gug-x [...]
{na4}e-gi-za3#?-⸢ga⸣ {na4#}gi-rin#?-[...] {na4}an-zu2#!?-[... {na4}]nir2#?-⸢muš⸣-gir2
{d}nin-urta dumu {d}en-lil2-la2-ke4 nam am3-ib2-tar-re
a#?-[...] ⸢ba⸣-du ⸢nita⸣ munus ⸢dim2⸣-ma ⸢u3⸣ za-e-gin7 ki-gu10-uš
nam-tag#? [...]-tuku šu-zu e2-gar8-am3 ba-da-x-x-en
ki-inim#?-ma#?-⸢ka⸣ ⸢ni2⸣ mu-e-ni-bulug5
ad gi4-gi4-da ga2-e mi-ni-ib2-bulug5-en
⸢pu⸣-⸢uh2⸣-ru-ma šagina-me-en inim#? gar-ra-gin7
⸢{na4}nir2⸣ geštin lal3-e ha-ma-pa3-⸢de3⸣
ku3-sig17 zi-de3-eš ⸢mi2⸣ ⸢he2⸣-[...]-en-ze2-en
u2-⸢sag⸣ dingir-re-e-⸢ne⸣-ka
kur-kur-re giri17 ki šu2-šu2-zu giri17 šu ⸢ha⸣-ba-ab-⸢tag⸣-ge
lugal-gu10 {na4}gir2-zu2-gal-⸢la⸣-ke4 ba-gub igi dul2? ⸢ba⸣-an-ak
My king attended to the eleli stone
Ninurta, the son of Enlil, was decreeing (its) fate
eleli stone, possessed of wisdom, when the mountain sows discord, I shall cast down my aura upon you
Upon my rebel land (whose) people confront together, you(?) shall invoke my name
You shall not diminish from your healthy/intact state
The reduction of your thickness shall be difficult(?)
My cosmic powers shall regulate (your) rites(!?)
You shall be greatly suited for my smiting weapon which kills the hero
In my supreme courtyard(!?) a pedestal shall be set down for you
(May) the land(?) admire (you) sweetly, the (foreign) lands shall raise (you)
The hero attended to the kagina stone
He spoke (to it) because of its might
Ninurta, the son of Enlil, was decreeing (its) fate
Reverent youth who sets (saturated) light to the outside
kagina stone, you who put down a shout for me in the rebel land
My hand did not conquer you (as) an arrogant one(?)
And therefore(?) I did not bind you(?) together with the hostile ones
The guggazi and marhali stones
The egizaga, girinhiliba, anzugulme and nirmušir stones
The lord, ...
Ninurta, the son of Enlil, was decreeing (its) fate
Whatever(?) ... you go, (whether) formed as(?) male and female, you thus(?) “towards my place”
You possessed no sin, your hand “pushes"(?) that which is a wall (demonstrating solidarity or inactivity as a conspirator?)
As a witness(?), (you) boasted about me/yourself(?)
I will rear you(!) in/on (my lap, etc.) together with “an adviser"(?)
Like one who made the claim(?) “I am the general” in the assembly(?)
nir stone(?), (you) shall chose among(?) the wine and syrup for me(?)
You (pl.) shall faithfully care for gold (which you are inlaid with?)
Among(?) the ... of the gods
The lands shall touch the nose in submission when you(?) grovel(?)
My king attended to the flint, he looked at it angrily
